title.narrative: Continuum of Care: Addressing PPH in India and Nigeria

description.narrative: With funding from the MacArthur Foundation, Pathfinder implements its second phase of the continuum of care project with the goal of contributing to the reduction of maternal mortality and morbidity due to PPH. The first phase of the project sought to prevent PPH, manage PPH when it occurred, and in more extreme cases, managed and treated shock (utilizing the non-pneumatic anti-shock garment [NASG]). The project extended from the community, where women are most likely to give birth at home or at the lowest levels of the health system, to higher level facilities where women can receive care for complications. In Nigeria, the project was implemented in 60 health facilities in seven states, and in India, the RAKSHA (Sanskrit for protection) project was implemented in 51 facilities in the state of Rajasthan.

activity-date.narrative: Actual end date of the activity
